newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australia's Vanstone sees good jobs outlook.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australia's Vanstone sees good jobs outlook.

text.p: Australian Employment Minister Amanda Vanstone said on Thursday that the outlook for the labour market was improving.
The latest April jobs data showed a continuing flat labour market, Vanstone said in a statement.

"However, key indicators such as the ANZ vacancy series and the DEETYA leading indicator of employment suggest that the prognosis for employment growth over the next year is positive," she said in a statement.
Vanstone refused to comment on Treasury Secretary Ted Evans' earlier statements that employment growth and unemployment were unlikely to meet government forecasts.
The Australian Bureau of Statistics reported that the April unemployment rate was 8.7 percent, unchanged from March. Monthly employment growth was 37,100, reversing a big fall seen in March.
In January the government forecast 1.5 percent year-average employment growth and an unemployment rate averaging 8.5 percent in the June quarter.
